column4: Charges to be dropped against banker in tussle with NY cabbie
column5: Oct 12 Charges against a high-ranking Morgan Stanley banker accused of stabbing a New York City cab driver in a dispute over a long-distance fare are set to be dismissed  Connecticut police and the cabbie's attorney said on Friday.

column4: STOCKS NEWS INDONESIA-Morgan Stanley positive on cement sector
column5: Morgan Stanley Research said it is positive on Indonesia's cement sector as there are signs of higher infrastructure spending and as the industry's growth prospects remained intact  underpinned by higher-than-expected cement consumption in September.

column4: Microsoft to sue Google with Motorola in German patent row
column5: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp said on Friday it plans to add Google Inc as a defendant in Germany in one of its patent actions against Google's phone maker  Motorola Mobility  the first time the two tech giants have come into direct legal conflict over Google's Android mobile software.

column4: NRC report says Diablo Canyon able to withstand Shoreline fault

column5: TORONTO  Oct 12 Toronto's main stock index opened little changed on Friday  as investors digested results from a pair of major U.S. banks and as concerns about slowing global economic growth limited the appeal of riskier assets.

column4: U.S. consumer sentiment jumps ahead of elections
column5: NEW YORK U.S. consumer sentiment unexpectedly rose to its highest in five years in October in the latest in a string of encouraging signs from the economy that may boost President Barack Obama's re-election hopes next month.

column4: Cyber attacks against Wells Fargo "significant " handled well: CFO
